title: Value-Based Payment Ups Adherence to Mental Health Guidelines
description: Value-based payments helped improve adherence to evidence-based mental healthcare guidelines in a Washington State population health management collaborative.

title: How technology can help providers improve pop health efforts
description: Data is essential in helping healthcare organizations manage care, and it also can direct patient-provider communication to optimize engagement.

title: Cut 2 regulations for every new 1: How Trump's latest executive order may affect healthcare
description: President Donald Trump issued an executive order Monday aimed at eliminating two federal regulations for every new one - an order that has the potential to significantly cut or confuse healthcare regulation. The order also requires the costs of any new regulations to be offset by the two that are cut.

title: Considering HIPAA Privacy Rule with Mental Health Data
description: The HIPAA Privacy Rule cannot be overlooked as providers care for patients being treated for mental health or substance abuse disorders.

title: How HIPAA enforcement could change in 2017
description: Under the Trump administration, some believe that regulatory burdens could be relieved, but privacy and security rules remain high priorities.

title: Rethinking Current Approaches to Health IT Interoperability
description: Achieving true interoperability will require healthcare organizations to connect their health IT infrastructure to a larger network than their own.
body: Achieving true interoperability will require healthcare organizations to connect their health IT infrastructure to a larger network than their own.

title: Value-Based Care: Yes, There Is Low-Hanging Fruit
description: Most have a broad set of responsibilities that span information systems management, infrastructure upgrades, health data security and patient engagement. Typically they are also challenged by overarching dynamics that characterize the healthcare industry, including the rapid pace of change, an uncertain regulatory environment, physician fatigue and burnout, an increase in data breaches, the consumerization of healthcare, an upsurge in mergers and acquisitions, and more.
body: Most have a broad set of responsibilities that span information systems management, infrastructure upgrades, health data security and patient engagement. Typically they are also challenged by overarching dynamics that characterize the healthcare industry, including the rapid pace of change, an uncertain regulatory environment, physician fatigue and burnout, an increase in data breaches, the consumerization of healthcare, an upsurge in mergers and acquisitions, and more.

title: KPMG survey finds 50% of health systems receive value-based reimbursement
description: Half of healthcare systems get some or most of their reimbursement under contracts that put them at risk for the cost and quality of care, according to a new KPMG survey. The results are somewhat more upbeat than a Modern Healthcare survey last June.
body: Half of healthcare systems get some or most of their reimbursement under contracts that put them at risk for the cost and quality of care, according to a new KPMG survey. The results are somewhat more upbeat than a Modern Healthcare survey last June.

title: 3 ways to curb fraud with advanced analytics
description: Healthcare organizations are beginning to use data to track down, prevent and counter efforts to stop attempts by criminals to profit from illegal activities.

title: Despite looming ACA repeal, key aspects of value charge ahead
description: While Republicans are taking steps to unwind Obamacare, the basic tenets of value-based care are advancing, and IT will be key for providers, says John Halamka.
body: While Republicans are taking steps to unwind Obamacare, the basic tenets of value-based care are advancing, and IT will be key for providers, says John Halamka.

title: Healthcare's Latest Interoperability Push
description: Across the healthcare ecosystem, it's hardly a secret that providers struggle to get pertinent medical information from exchange partners who use a different electronic health record (EHR) from their own. And if the provider wants to do something impactful with that health data-say receive it in a way that facilitates improvement in patient care, for example-the struggle becomes even more real.
body: Across the healthcare ecosystem, it's hardly a secret that providers struggle to get pertinent medical information from exchange partners who use a different electronic health record (EHR) from their own. And if the provider wants to do something impactful with that health data-say receive it in a way that facilitates improvement in patient care, for example-the struggle becomes even more real.

title: Are You Ready to Make the Transition to MACRA?
description: While 2017 is considered a "transition year" for the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act, better known as MACRA, it is certainly no time to coast. Over time, this physician-focused quality payment program will either reward, penalize or provide zero adjustment to a clinician's reimbursement, depending on their performance.
body: While 2017 is considered a "transition year" for the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act, better known as MACRA, it is certainly no time to coast. Over time, this physician-focused quality payment program will either reward, penalize or provide zero adjustment to a clinician's reimbursement, depending on their performance.

title: 8 trends affecting how physician practices will use IT in 2017
description: EHR usability, certification requirements will be among top concerns in the New Year.

title: 3 Ways Bundled Payment Models Brought Hospital Cost Savings

title: Bridging the Gap Between Big Data Science, Health IT Usability
description: The health IT landscape often seems starkly divided between two opposing camps: those who design elegant algorithms and regimented workflows in the idealized sterility of the R&D department, and those whose frenzied, frustrating daily experience in the hospital, office, or clinic have taught them that there is no such thing as an out-of-the-box solution to any of their big data needs.
body: The health IT landscape often seems starkly divided between two opposing camps: those who design elegant algorithms and regimented workflows in the idealized sterility of the R&D department, and those whose frenzied, frustrating daily experience in the hospital, office, or clinic have taught them that there is no such thing as an out-of-the-box solution to any of their big data needs.

title: Physicians, EHR vendors share burden in readying for MACRA
description: In healthcare, every interaction with the patient matters. Especially in today's environment of continuous improvement, efforts have been concentrated on coordination among providers, the patient care experience and quality outcomes - all laudable goals.
body: In healthcare, every interaction with the patient matters. Especially in today's environment of continuous improvement, efforts have been concentrated on coordination among providers, the patient care experience and quality outcomes - all laudable goals.

title: 5 key coding opportunities in 2017
description: The calendar may say the ICD-10 transition is long gone, but practices still will likely feel its repercussions in 2017 in terms of payer requests, denials and the new code set's influence on value-based care.

title: Why Healthcare Bundled Payment Models May Expand in 2017
description: CMS has advanced bundled payment models by implementing these value-based payment structures in orthopedic and cardiac care.
